clinical_study.brief_title: Geriatric Communication Skills Training Program for Oncology Clinicians
clinical_study.official_title: Geriatric Communication Skills Training Program for Oncology Clinicians to Improve Management of Care for Geriatrics Cancer Patients

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to learn more about the effects of a training program designed to help doctors communicate better with older patients and their caregivers.

primary_outcome.measure: Feasibility of Health Care Provider (HCP) training
primary_outcome.description: Measured by number of HCP successfully recruited for the training

primary_outcome.measure: Participants satisfaction with Health Care Provider (HCP) training

arm_group.description: Doctors specializing in treating gastrointestinal cancer (cancer of the stomach, pancreas, colon, etc.), genitourinary cancer (cancer of the genitals and urinary tract), and lymphoma (cancer affecting the blood and lymph nodes)
Patients of the physicians in group 1

arm_group.arm_group_label: Caregivers of Participants with GI/GU/Lymphoma Cancer
arm_group.description: Family members or caregivers of the patients in group 2

intervention.description: Health Care Professional's self-efficacy will be assessed by 12 ratings of self-reported confidence from (1) "strongly disagree" to (5) "strongly agree" in module-specific topics both before and after the training.
The UCLA Geriatrics Attitudes Scale is a 14-item scale developed to assess health care providers' attitudes toward older persons and caring for older patients.
The UCLA Geriatric Knowledge Test is composed of 23-item multiple choice responses to worded questions or incomplete statements.

The evaluation survey will contain eight statements assessing post-training attitudes regarding the skills learned and application of skills in oncology clinical practice, measured on a 5-point Likert scale with anchors at (1) "strongly disagree" to (5) "strongly agree."

intervention.intervention_name: The Consultation and Relational Empathy (CARE) questionnaire
intervention.description: The Consultation and Relational Empathy (CARE) questionnaire is a 10-item self-report scale that measures a patient's satisfaction with how empathic their physician was within a specific consultation.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
Clinician Eligibility
- MSK medical oncology Health Care Professionals (HCP) - specifically identified as Attendings, fellows, or Advance Practice Professional (APP) - either a Nurse Practitioner (NP) or Physician Assistant (PA) from GI, GU Oncology, Lymphoma, or Bone Marrow Transplant (four services with a large number of geriatric patients)
- Willingness to be audio-recorded as per self-report
Patient Eligibility
- MSK patients 65 years and over as per EMR
- English speaking as per EMR
- Undergoing treatment for cancer by one of the consented HCPs as per the HCP and/or electronic medical record (EMR)
- Willingness to be audio-recorded as per self-report
Caregiver Eligibility
- English speaking as per EMR
- Accompanying an MSK patient undergoing treatment for cancer by one of the consented HCPs as per the HCP and/or EMR
